p: IC 50 values of the wild bilberry leaves extract was 2.13 mg/mL ( Table 5). The activity of the investigated extract was very close to positive control, BHT (IC 50 = 2.07 mg/mL), meaning that it possessed high antioxidant capacity. However, antioxidant activity of the tested extract was lower compared to Î±-tocopherol ( Table 5). In comparison to early published data [ 25], measured IC 50 value of the extract was lower indicating its higher the hydrogen donating capacity.
